Interview Questions: Strength? Weakness? What would your coworkers say about you?

title: Education Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied for job in late December, and then was emailed regarding setting up a phone screen. I then had the initial phone screen with HR, with a follow-up Skype interview with the hiring managers in my department. My offer came in February.
Interview Questions: Asked for examples of problems solved in the workplace and what my plan of action was in solving them.

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions: After filling in an application form online, I was contacted through email several weeks later for a chance to set up a general interview. During the interview general questions were asked, what the salary would be and what to expect for the SECOND interview, which would be with the actual hiring team for the specified floor that you chose to interview. There would be 6-8 team members during the second interview. The interview processes is extremely slow and it takes time for them to set up interviews and answer back.
Interview Questions: Why Swedish Medical Center?

title: Senior Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2015
Interview Descriptions:
First Round on campus, one case followed by a behavioral.  A second round was offered at their office and was rather informal.  
The first round interview will be with two team members from the department, most likely a hiring manager and a senior team member.
Interview Questions: Tell us about how you handle situations where you are faced with something you do not know how to do?

title: Research Coordinator II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish
Interview Descriptions: friendly staff, interview coordinated by an admin through Google Calendar. Very quick follow up. Offered 2nd interview before I left from the first one. Offered the job before I left the 2nd interview
Interview Questions: how would your friends describe your personality? What part of your personality do you hope this position will accentuate?

title: Human Resources Director Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Swedish
Interview Descriptions: Very structured behavioral interviewing with strict adherence to interview questions.  I experienced no flexibility in the interviewers to ask exploratory questions based on what you said - always used the boxed questions.  Made the interview a bit awkward and stiff feeling to me as the interviewee.  Just be prepared for this very structured approach.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Phlebotomist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Swedish (Englewood, CO) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was transferred from another facility. No interview usually was required. I got good referrals from another facility.       I worked already 1 year in same facility but in different location.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Patient Services Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is long and tedious. If HR believes you do not have the degree they desire or the minimum experience of 5 years, they will not contact you. If you have a manager who wishes to hire you even without a degree, they must work around HR to hire you.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in growth, medically?

title: Pateint Care Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Scattered and unorganized - as the company is transitioned into Providence systems, the quality of people and level of experience is exceptionally low with very few people coming from a medical background. The process was crazy - first HR, then multiple clinic directors, all with different agendas and needs, and no solid clarification on the direction or the needs of the position. Constant mention of replacing "seat fillers" - be wary - not even woth the experience on your resume at tyhis point.
Interview Questions: How do you tolerate verbal and sometimes physical abuse?

title: PSC Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Swedish
Interview Descriptions: phone interview, in person interview, meet and greet. Time from application submission until they contact me for an interview was long- months! But after interviewing, I was offered the position right away. new employees go through a  2 day corporate training upon hire
Interview Questions: How do you prioritize?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Edmonds, WA) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: My hiring manager was really nice, honest and direct. She asked me how to describe myself as a worker and gave me an opportunity to discuss my work experience. Then she talked about what she was looking for an employee. We had a match which was perfect!
Interview Questions: Everything was straight forward. I wasn't thrown off guard with any particular question.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Video interview, phone interview, and face interview.it was to the point and I was offered the job the same day as the face interview.the manager and assistant manager was very nice , gave a tour of the clinic, and gave staff a chance to ask me questions.it was very easy.
Interview Questions: How do you handle stressful situations

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: 3 interviews; with HR, manager, and panel. competitive, but it was a straight forward process. be able to talk about experiences and show your personality- engaged, motivated, and desire to learn are all important over knowing specific RN tasks. ask questions at the end!
Interview Questions: conflict management, making mistakes and owning up, communication. very straightforward. think behavioral questions and have some scenarios that highlight your ability to communicate, use resources, and work well within a team.

title: Dispatcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Swedish in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Professional and really thorough. Was a little nervous, the manager was really intense at the time of the interview. I was asked alot of questions about situations having to do with the job I applied for.
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult co-worker

title: Registered Nurse Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions:
I initially filled out a general online application for the RN resident program. I was contacted by HR to schedule an initial interview which had to be on the phone due to me being out of town. I didn't hear anything after the interview for 2 weeks and I had to reach out for them to tell me I was selected to continue on. It was another 2 weeks between that point and my in person peer interview. This interview took place on the specific unit with two nurse managers and two current floor nurses. They "graded" each interviewee and supposedly ranked each one and decided from there. I had no issues with the actual interviews.

However, the hiring/interview process for this specific RN resident program was a disaster. The first "hiccup" happened for the phone interview--the interviewer had no idea that it was a phone interview thus calling me 50 minutes late after I spoke with the recruiting coordinator. The time lag between initial application and in-person interview was over two months and the time it took to make the decision was unexpectedly long. I felt as though I would never have been contacted if I didn't reach out several times along the way. It seemed as though the communication between the various departments was rather disorganized. The coordination HR and the unit managers seemed disjointed. I know I am not the only one who had such difficulties with this process through Swedish.
Interview Questions: The questions were as to be expected. The phone interview was typical questions such as why Swedish? Why (insert specialty here)? Can you commit to working two years for Swedish? etc. The in-person peer interview questions looked for specific examples of situations where you had to adapt, lead, etc.

title: NICU RN Residency Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online for the residency position and emailed HR to check in. I was eventually given a date for a phone interview and afterwards received a call back to schedule an in person interview. This particular unit used an interview team with a variety of employees for a behavioral interview before giving me a tour of the NICU.
Interview Questions: All were behavioral questions, just remember to work on developing specific examples you can apply to a variety of questions. My most difficult question was regarding how I handle conflict. But I believe they just want to make sure you are well spoken and manage conflict in a responsible, respectful manner.

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Swedish
Interview Descriptions:
lots of behavioral questions, and "name a time when" questions.
Its good to  kind of write down some past experiences where you had to go above and beyond, or when you dealt  with an irate customer ect
Interview Questions: the questions where all pretty standard

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: group style peer interview with questions more aimed at your problem solving skills.  They seemed to be checking into your interpersonal skills.  The were checking to see if I would fit into the culture and team on that particular floor.  They were very honest concerning the staffing matrix and my expected duties and competencies.  The interview team was comprised of multiple members of other floors from all levels including managers, CNA, and staff RNs.
Interview Questions: name a difficult situation that you have had in the hospital setting and how you handled it safely to the patient's satisfaction

title: Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish
Interview Descriptions: It can be hard to get your foot in the door. It does help to know someone who can give your resume directly to the manager in addition to going through HR. That is what I was finally able to do after trying to get a job here for a couple of years. The hiring and interview process is quite prolonged and thorough. At the time I was hired, new employees had to take a behavioral test which asked questions like "Would you take home office supplies for personal use?" I don't believe they do that anymore, however. Current interviewing usually involves an individual and panel interview. Once you are hired, there is an extensive background check.
Interview Questions: I don't really remember. But I know that current interviews involve questions about specific scenarios and how you would handle each one.

title: Patient Access Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish
Interview Descriptions:
The hiring process starts with a phone interview with a recruiter. Once this is complete, an interview is scheduled with the hiring manager and possibly two team members. In most situations this is the end of the process and the manager of the department will make a selection. HR will then call and make a job offer. 

During the process, I had a second interview and was interrogated by the a senior leadership person. This should have been a huge red flag. The red flag was ignored. The department manager offered the job over the phone. The rate of pay was significantly less that what a contract person was making for the same position. The manager was embarrassed. The manager contacted HR to obtain a pay range to offer. It was a little better that what the contract pay was.
Interview Questions: The most difficult was to keep my composure while being interrogated by a senior leader. It was awful and very unexpected. I had never experience anything like this before. She was rude, demeaning, and very unprofessional.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Swedish (Englewood, CO) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: met with assistant director, then they wanted me to meet some of the staff.  We talked about the typical interview questions.  asked a few clinical questions. showed me around the unit
Interview Questions: where do i see myself in 5 years

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2+ months. I interviewed at Swedish
Interview Descriptions: After applying online it took a little over a month before I received a call from HR. A quick phone interview was conducted and then an in person interview was set up for the following week. The interview was fairly standard. We went over my resume and then went over some scenarios that could come up, and some past scenarios that were related to issues that could come up in the job. The interviewer was very friendly and I felt very comfortable! After that I met with the clinic supervisor for another interview. That was very general. We went over my resume and skills and discussed the position and work environment. Very laid back.
Interview Questions: For me, I did not find any questions to be particularly difficult. I would say be prepared with examples of past difficulties in customer service settings, or examples of good and bad experiences with customers and/or co-workers.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions:
Basic, typical questions in a peer setting. 
Interviewed with HR over phone first. Interview was with a few RN's from the floor as well as the unit manager.  Everyone made me feel comfortable.  They asked about prior experience and why I wanted to return to floor nursing, as I was working as a transplant coordinator for the same hospital system.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a positive patient encounter

title: Revenue Cycle Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: First interview and last interview were approximately two months apart.Phone interview with recruiter. In person, panel interview that involved recruiter and two managers. Third interview involved hiring manager and team. Overall, this was a pretty standard interview process.
Interview Questions: Asked about education and prior healthcare experience.

title: Webmaster Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: They reached out to me (following my initial application) rather quickly. The recruiter was engaged and personable. The interview went very well and I felt there was a real professionalism and humor (it was an interview with two executives). The questions were pretty standard.
Interview Questions: Tell us the reason you want to leave your current employer.

title: Pharmacy Resident Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: Recruiting process, application submission via PhORCAS, interviews with 6-8 members of selection committee
Interview Questions: Have you ever stolen a pen?

title: Insurance Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: Had a phone interview with a recruiter, basic questions.  I have plenty of experience in this field but she just stopped calling me back, no word on the job.  I knew someone at the company who just passed my resume to the hiring manager, and she immediately noticed that I was perfectly qualified...HR is just a roadblock really. They called me in for an interview with 4 people, couple of supervisors and the department manager, someone from HR.  After the interview they had me take a 3 page test on billing terminology and practices, as well as basic coding.  Didn't know all the definitions but I don't think they expect you to get a perfect score.  They called me within a week with an offer, and I started shortly thereafter.  Pretty quick once I actually got past the initial HR phase.
Interview Questions: They asked about my posting experience, and really focused on how many dollars worth per day because this company is huge and posting is non-stop.

title: Volunteer/Internship Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Swedish (Edmonds, WA) in Dec 2010
Interview Descriptions: Contacted the Volunteer Services Manager by phone and left a message to inquire about volunteering to complete my internship. She returned my call and stated they had one position and I would need to fill out an application first. I filled out the application and returned it the following day in person. I left two follow up messages and have not received a call back. Its been two weeks. I also, was referred to the Birth and Family Clinic and emailed my resume to the Manager and did not receive any acknowledgement about an internship, again I was referred by the Educational Mgr at Stevens. I am really disappointed at the lack of follow up and communication from Stevens Hospital personnel. Its been two weeks going on three and I have not heard back yet.
Interview Questions: Would you mind working in an different area than your area of studies?

title: Grant and Contract Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Sept 2010
Interview Descriptions: As I lived out of state when I applied for my position, all 4 of my interviews were conducted by phone. The first was with the HR recruiter. The second was with the hiring manager. The third was with the hiring manager and the team I would be working with. The fourth was with the hiring manager and the managers of the departments I would be supporting in the organization. Further, because of the economy when I was interviewing (2010), Swedish was unable to bring me in for an in-person meeting/interview. Because of that, I met with the Team Lead for the hiring manager when she was traveling to my area. We met for coffee and she further interviewed me to address concerns raised by the team and departmental managers about my seeking a position in a city to which I had never been. She was gracious and offered pointers to cement my position as the top applicant. I was contacted by HR a couple of days later with an offer of employment. I rated the interview difficulty as "Difficult" because the process was long with multiple interviews (essentially 5 interviews total including HR's interview to establish my qualifications).
Interview Questions: I was asked if I would be willing to pay for a trip to Seattle to interview without the possibility of being reimbursed.

title: Nutrition Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Jul 2010
Interview Descriptions:
You are called by a Swedish recruiter if your résumé meets their qualifications and you are interviewed over the phone. If you pass, you then are set up for an interview in person. For me this took at least a month.
The in-person interview was easy as the position itself is pretty simple. You are asked about your food handling experience and customer service experience. Any hospital or related experience will of course increase your chances of getting this.
After having a job offer it took Swedish six months to hire me. No calls from the recruiter, nothing. One day out of the blue I got an e-mail asking me if I was still interested in the position.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult or angry patient.

title: CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Apr 2010
Interview Descriptions:
1st one is phone interview
then with hiring managers
Interview Questions: why this facility

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Swedish (Seattle, WA) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: Was contacted by HR via a referral from a former co-worker.  I had one phone interview and then was invited in for an all day interview with several staff members as a group and then several one on one interviews.  It is a very corporate atmosphere and there is a definitely an attitude of everyone should be doing more (a lot more) with less.
Interview Questions: How do you feel about data?
